sections.body:
State of Illinois,
County of Cook ss.

I, Chas. W. De Wolfe a Notary Public in and for the
County and State aforesaid, do hereby certify that E.P. Tallmadge
and E.G. Strain, personally known to me to be the same per-
sons whose names are subscribed to the foregoing instrument
as President and Secretary, respectively, of Tallmadge
& Burnes Co., appeared before me this day, in person, and
each severally acknowledged that they signed, sealed
and delivered the said instrument as their free and
voluntary act and as the free and voluntary act of said
corporation, for the uses and purposes therein set forth.
Given under my hand and Notorial seal this fifteenth
day of June A.D. 1900.

My commission expires Nov. 5, 1903
Chas. W. De Wolfe,
Notary Public.
(Seal)
Filed for record October 9th, A.D. 1921 10 P. M.

Deed.
This Indenture made, the 22nd day of September, 1909
between George F. Portage and Maud Portage,
his wife, of the County of Alameda and State of Cali-
fornia, parties of the first part; and Lakeside Land
Reclamation and Irrigation Company, a corporation
organized under the Laws of New Jersey, having its of-
fice at Riverside, in the County of Riverside and State
of California, party of the second part, Witnesseth:
That the parties of the first part for and in consider-
ation of the sum of One Dollar and other valuable
consideration to them in hand paid by the party
of the second part at or before the execution of this
instrument, the receipt of which consideration is
hereby acknowledged, and having granted,
and conveyed, unto the party of the second part, his
successors and assigns, all the following described
property, situated in the County of Alameda and State
of California, to wit:
A strip of land one hundred (100) feet in width, being
fifty (50) feet on each side of the middle line of the
